title: Are black holes real and what do they do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, they’re real. What do they do? That depends on what’s around them. In empty space, a black hole will just sit there spinning, warping space-time around them. If there’s matter nearby it will be drawn towards the thing just as though it was a really big star, and if that stuff isn’t moving fast enough to establish a stable orbit it winds up getting drawn in. If there’s so much matter that it can’t physically enter the whole without basically lining up it can create an ‘accretion disk’ which is sort of like a whirlpool. That will generally lead to ‘jets’ of matter and energy being ejected from the magnetic poles of the black hole. This is common during the early life of the supermassive black holes at the centers of most if not all galaxies. Those jets were called ‘quasars’ when first detected. They looked like stars but they were very, very far away.
